revised_title: SV40 Large-T Antigen: Structure and Function in Eukaryotic Chromosome Replication
tldr: The study focuses on the SV40 large-T antigen, a protein essential for initiating viral DNA replication and cellular transformation. The research explores the multifunctional aspects of the large-T antigen and its role in eukaryotic chromosome replication, including its involvement in DNA synthesis, regulation of viral transcription, and interaction with cellular proteins.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Molecular Biology
